Reviews.Title: “12:00 O'clock View of the Sydney Opera House”
Reviews.Author: ajuliagulia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my first visit to Australia and was looking for a reasonably priced room with a view of the Sydney Opera House. The Rendezvous Stafford Hotel did NOT disappoint me. My room was nicely furnished with a kitchenette, a dining area, a sitting area, and a balcony. Best of all, it had a 12:00 o'clock view of the Sydney Opera House and a 9:00 o'clock view of the Harbour Bridge. I was delighted! I feel obliged to note however that not all rooms had a view of the Opera House. I advice that you ask for it in advance. Their staff worked hard to satisfy my requests. It offered a complementary continental breakfast when I visited. It also had a swimming pool. As other reviewers have noted, it was located in the heart of the Rocks and steps away from Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location/views”
Reviews.Author: Bryn N
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in Sydney at this hotel in the Rocks area. We booked a room with a balcony and view of Opera House and Bridge. We were not disappointed, the view was fantastic and few other hotels can have a similar view with a balcony. Perfect position in the Rocks area. The hotel room itself was smallish, but adequate. Bed comfortable, but queen size. The hotel is due a makeover and will make it a very desirable location.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 star hotel in a 5 star location”
Reviews.Author: FijiFan77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the first floor over Easter and loved the location of the hotel. We had a full itinerary planned with trips to Taronga Zoo and Manly as well as Darling Harbour and Powerhouse mueseum. Our kids are 3 and 4 so being so close to Circular Quay made walking to the ferries and back much easier. There were a number of restaurants and cafes within easy walking distance and the Sunday markets had lots of food stalls too which were very interesting. As for the hotel itself, it was adequate for the purpose we had picked it for, that is, a place to sleep after a long day of touring. The room seemed very dated and the pull out sofa bed was the worst example of its type I have ever encountered. The place was clean though and it had a kitchenette which was very handy for those travelling with children. The pool and spa area was quite nice and we used it a couple of times to wind down after a big day of touring. There was a coin operated guest laundry onsite too, again very handy when travelling with small children. The staff were always polite and helpful and the three hours free wi fi per day was very useful too. This hotel is ideal if you're not planning to spend a lot of time in your room and the location more than compensates for any deficiencies.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Shaunwaz
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of the Rocks in Sydney. Walking distance to the opera house, harbour bridge & everything else circular quay has to offer! We had two rooms for our stay, one room was on level 1 with no view but was still clean & comfortable, the second room was a level 9 apartment... This room was excellent with views of circular quay. The hotel staff are very friendly and do their best to ensure an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: KvetaDavid
Reviews.Content: We had a studio suite with all the comforts and conveniences of home. The suite had really nice decor and great spacial design. Located right on the Rocks of Sydney, all central attractions were easy walking distance. Lots of charm on a small street with a touch of class. Staff was very helpful re: info for sight seeing, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Sydney pricing, needs a refurb.”
Reviews.Author: thepolarbeer
Reviews.Content: Great location is the major draw card. 3 star quality and a little tired. Very large room but overall fitout needs upgrading, pillows in particular.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: MSCBrisbane
Reviews.Content: I loved this cute little hotel Great location just steps from the Rocks markets & from all of the great little pubs in the area. Less than 4 minutes by foot & you are on the harbour Traditional style accommodation but the pool area was very modern. Our room was clean however the fold out couch in the lounge was a little shabby with the mattress being quiet lumpy Breakfast looked lovely (wasn't included in my package) The staff were only happy to help with all of our requests

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: donnakayej
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a gem. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was modern, clean and comfortable. Best of all was the location in the Rocks area of Sydney. So much to do and see within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired, but overall good”
Reviews.Author: winegirl2
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I shared the Harbour view studio apartment for 4 nights. The view of the Opera house was great (which she loved!). She took the Queen bed - very comfortable she said, and I took the pull-out sofa - a bit mushy, but workable and clean.There were plenty of pillows and blankets. The studio has a kitchenette which was perfect for us to have breakfast and maybe a pre-dinner glass of wine. The closet was big enough for both of us to have a half, and not get in the way of the other, but get real hangars (!). The bathroom is small, but again we made it work. We had an upper floor room, so it was quiet, surprising for a very busy area. We went in the outdoor pool - decent, but I hate unheated pools (:, and the gym (or closet is more like it) needs an upgrade. There's no reason not to have hand weights available. The front desk personnel were always very nice and helpful - lent us an umbrella when it was pouring rain out. I did alot of research, and if you want to be located in the Rocks, this was the best value.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennysionidog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our month's tour of Australia in February this year (2012). We found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and central (right in the middle of the Rocks) and the staff friendly and helpful. Our bedroom overlooked the swimming pool, had good air con, a balcony and a small kitchen. We didn't use the kitchen as we were only in Sydney for 3 nights but would have found it very useful if we had been staying longer. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, this was buffet style but very good. My only complaint is the chairs were very uncomfortable in the breakfast room but it didn't spoil our time there at all. We ate out every evening as the hotel was based right in the middle of the Rocks and near Circular Quay so plenty of choice of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “great location, big unit but old”
Reviews.Author: MickandFee
Reviews.Content: in the heart of the rocks, short easy walk everywhere, plenty of room to spread out, guest laundry was handy. rooms are tired but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lucybr0wn
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the first floor. Very old and tired room for $300 could have got better.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: brucestalker1
Reviews.Content: Good location, very helpful staff who checked in our flights on line for us and printed boarding passes. Very good pricing policy on the mini-bar and the room was more than the typical anonymous type you get at some of the larger chains. Would have liked a bar to visit when we got back at the end of the evening for a nightcap and chat with other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jenso13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 weeks due to my husbands working commitments. The location was excellent walking distance to most of the main attractions, restaurants and public transport. The hotel staff were extremely friendly, helpful and would do anything possible to make your stay a comfortable enjoyable one. I found the beds and pillows very comfortable which was a blessing considering the amount of time we spent there. Our room had a kitchenette, dinning suite and desk. Although not many kitchen utensils we got away with what was there. The only downfall I would say was the toaster which wouldn't switch itself off. The other thing i really liked about the room was once inside how quiet it was, no hearing the people next doors tv or talking made it feel more private. The pool is heated and there is also a spa and sauna. There is also a fully equipped gym. I have found the laundry to be very handy and inexpensive. I have stayed at other more plush hotels at the rocks but for customer service,value for money and the location this is the hotel that I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but ordinary in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Andrew - Kristi... D
Reviews.Content: The Rocks is a great spot from which to explore Sydney. Close to Circular Quay and great transport options, the Opera House, brilliant restaurants, gallery, business, friends or whatever. In the big city, the Rocks has that intimatevillage feel and the Rendezvous is right in the middle. The location is brilliant, rooms are just bigger than small and adequate without being chic or fashionable. The kitchenette is basic but useful, but overall the rooms are just a bit jaded and could do with a thorough rejuvenation. The general hotel facilities are best described as mediocre. But at least you can escape into the Rocks. We had a nice special price which made the lack of swish and class bearable. If you are going to the Rocks, look for the specials, since the rest of the hotels near here are inordinately expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great harbour views if you get a 1 bed apartment on 6th floor”
Reviews.Author: JacsDumbarton
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel in January 2012. Wanted to have a full harbour view room and got what I wanted. I paid Â£250GBP for a one bedroom harbour view apartment and I would say it done what it said on the tin. The room was clean, spacious and the views were amazing. Harbour bridge on the left of the balcony and opera house straight ahead. The balcony was huge and had 2 sun loungers and a table and chairs to enjoy the view. I was fortunate enough to get a small fireworks display happen the night I was there which made the night complete. It is in a great location in the Rocks, easy to get to from circular quay..even walking with luggage, a small uphill walk but nothing bad. The door is kind of concealed but still easy enough to find. I didn't have breakfast included and hadn't planned on eating in the hotel, however, in the morning it was pouring with rain so decided to use the buffet breakfast, at $24aud it was not worth the money, very basic cooked food, toast, banana bread, fruit and cereal. If you book the night before it is cheaper but not much. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. I only wish I had been able to get use of the pool facilities but the weather is not in the hands of the hotel staff haha....if ur looking for harbour views, outdoor pool, handy for the rocks and circular quay then this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, great room”
Reviews.Author: Kym P
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. We had a 6th floor room which had great harbour views. Perfectly located at The Rocks, central to all attractions. The kitchen was a bonus and the rooms were very spacious with a full longe area, dining table, separate bedroom and ensure. On the flip side the room was a little tired, the bed a bit hard and the wi-fi slow with many black spots. Overall we had a great experience. We would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to our friends. great value in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Helen B
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have stayed on two separate occasions at the Rendezvous, for only one night each time. We are promising ourselves that on the next occasion we will stay for longer as we really enjoyed ourselves each time. We chose the hotel initially because of its proximity to the Opera House, where we were attending evening concerts, however we very quickly found the hotel and its friendly atmosphere and good facilities (including nice pool and sauna) very much to our liking. The Rendezvous Stafford represents excellent value for money; the rooms were very clean and a good size, and the service was excellent. The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. We are looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Central but quiet”
Reviews.Author: lird5
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night s at the Rendezvous. The location was fantastic â€“ we had a glimpse of the Opera House from our room. It was within walking distance of Circular Quay station â€“ but we hadnâ€™t counted on the steps when towing our suitcases, although on the way back when we knew our way around we found an easier way with no steps. The front desk staff were always friendly as we walked by and check in was very efficient. Storing our bags after check out until we left Sydney was no problem. The room was clean, in good repair, very quiet and big enough for 2. The kitchen a bonus but the bed could have been larger. The desk with lamp was appreciated. The pool was a pleasant temperature and good to relax after sightseeing. The Rocks is a fascinating area to walk around â€“ we kept finding new staircases and laneways. Close by the hotel is the Visitor Information Centre â€“ make this your first call.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel close to the city”
Reviews.Author: OrientalSweetlips_HK
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family of 5 (2 adults, 3 young children) at the Rendezvous in August. We booked one of the town houses that front Harrington Street and were very impressed with the size - two bedrooms, one upstairs and one downstairs plus the bathroom upstairs and kitchen area at the back. It was a great room with lots of space for luggage and storage, although the stairs were very steep and we had to supervise our youngest as he walked up and down them. Large fridge allowed us to stock up at the local supermarket as well as an oven and kettle and two large flat screen TV's for the kids to watch. The best thing is of course the very convenient location in The Rocks, only a 5 minute walk from Circular Quay and similar time to get into the CBD. Staff were friendly and helpful, although the only niggle is that the room wasn't ready for us until the afternoon - we had arrived in the morning simply because that was the time our flight arrived - however, we were able to drop our bags behind reception and wander off for a while to get some breakfast. Free Wifi was available throughout the hotel for a couple of hours a day - password supplied by reception. Overall it was a great place to stay and a great way to get full use from older buildings - something Sydney does very well. (in HK they would be knocked down!) We didn't use the pool because it was winter but I believe it was heated and certainly large enough for kids to have some fun in.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get over the jet lag!”
Reviews.Author: UKSassyC
Reviews.Content: We started off here at the beginning of a 3 week trip to Aus and what a great start it was! A huge room, pretty clean, very clean bathroom, great view from window over harbour to Opera House. We were very impressed by the breakfast and due to adjusting to the time difference were usually down waiting for the lovely lady to finish setting up (breakfast opened at 6am!) We were relieved that we were allowed to store our bags on arrival because our flight got in at 7am so we were at hotel by 9.30am! We found the receptionists friendly and helpful, although we heard other guests getting stroppy and aggressive about broken fixtures in their rooms. The hotel doesn't seem to be aimed at families but they found us a highchair for our little boy's breakfast. We did spend a lot of time when in our room removing him from the kitchen area- you could tell they weren't expecting families when they installed the highly intriguing microwave at a toddler's eye-level! We found the lack of hotel information in the room annoying, we only found the laundry on our last day, we had to go down to reception to ask about breakfast timing and when the pool shut. The pool was nice, if small, and we really appreciated the safety gate. The two receptionists on our last day were so lovely, printing out google maps for us to find our car hire place, and then our route to our first stopover! If you are staying here as a leisure visitor to Sydney then your first call must be into the Rocks Tourist Information Office, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Disssapointing first below average stay in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: islandhoppers
Reviews.Content: Good prices for sure, but the room was in a sad state. I really don't like it when a hotel has no alarm clock either. But, great location for sure, nice staff, and a nice pool area to relax in if you have time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bunsenandbeeker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the last leg of our three week Australian getaway. We were not very happy with the first room they gave us. It was sub-par and on street level. The room looked unclean and poorly lit. Definitely not what the picture shows on the internet...Beware! We asked for a different room and they tried to be very accommodating. The second room was a bit better so we settled for this one. However, the refrigerator was very noisy and we ended up unplugging it during our stay. The beds were very uncomfortable. The hotel is within walking distance to most tourist locations like the harbor, opera house, bridge, botanical gardens, etc. For the price we paid though, I would expect a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour location.”
Reviews.Author: theroux178
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Rendezvous for one night, December 2011. The room was clean and neat, and the sofa bed was made up when we arrived, as I requested when booking online (booking.com), and confirmed over the phone. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay close to Sydney Harbour; it is fabulous for exploring the Rocks, and just a short walk to the Botanical Gardens and Opera House, ferries and Circular Quay. Staff were friendly, and although we did not use the kitchenette, it's presence is a definite plus. The only (very slight) negatives were that the bathroom was a little dark, and we could not find any digital channels on the TV. Our view from the 5th floor was directly East, onto the Opera house and quay. Quiet despite the central location, helpful staff, clean and functional. If you are exploring the Harbour and surrounds, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility!”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshireScotts
Reviews.Content: Large room, well fitted out, and kept clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. As other reviews have stated, the location is excellent. Central Sydney and it's many highlights, like the Opera House and Botanical Gardens, are a short walk away, as is Circular Quay, from which suburbs, including Manly, Darling Harbour and Balmain, can be accessed by ferry. On a return to Sydney we would stay at Rendezvous Stafford Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: OMG, the location is perfect for staying in Sydney. We stayed in one of the cheapest rooms and got a good deal through Laterooms.com. The room has a little self catering kitchen - it is a bit dated, but its all clean and the rest of the room was great. No views from our room (I imagine higher up you do), but that doesn't matter - it is right in the middle of the Rocks area and next to the Harbour bridge. You can literally step out of the hotel and be yards from the best bits of Sydney. The service was very good too and you get 3 hours free WiFi a day (the clock starts ticking as soon as you log on, so its really only one session a day). There is a pool, but its very small, and like I say - this place is all about the location.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: therunners055
Reviews.Content: Stunning location. Stayed in June 2011 and loved the view of the Opera House from my room.Hotel is very well located for sightseeing. Rooms are clean, breakfasts good and the small outside pool a delight. Only criticisms would be that as we were arriving early (i.e.6a.m. from the UK we'd requested an early check in but in fact got a late check in (i.e.12.45) as someone had checked out late. This was in spite of the fact that the hotel wasn't full. Also we'd requested adjacent rooms as we were travelling together.....at least we were on the same floor.

Reviews.Title: “What a View!”
Reviews.Author: RedRose2020
Reviews.Content: We booked the Harbour View Studio and the view was just amazing!! Both the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge right there in front of us and so close!! On our first night there were fireworks at the Opera House we were just blown away watching them from our balcony!! Its a fantastic location walking distance to everything! A very nice hotel very clean and beautifully presented. Staff were so friendly and helpful especially Emily she was just fantastic so helpful and made the stay so much more pleasurable. I would really recommend this hotel and The Rocks location can't be beaten its so much fun with the Fri, Sat, Sun Market at the end of our street, the Harbour Bridge and Opera House minutes walk away and the beautiful character of the area but yet it still manages to be a quiet location just incredible! I would defiantly stay here again on my next stay to Sydney! Thanks again to Emily for being so much fun and so helpful helping us to find all the top locations to visit in our short time in Sydney we'd stay here again because of her friendly service making us feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Syndey Rocks”
Reviews.Author: IandD46
Reviews.Content: Greatlocation right at the harbour. the train goes from the airport to queen's quay and then it is only about a 5 minute walk to the hotel. from our small balcony we could see the top of syndey harbour bridge- a major highlight in the morning. Only able to spend 2 nights and would have liked to have stayed longer. the room was very comfortable and the kitchenette was adequate. We arrived late and the front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. Very good value for money given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozholoct
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great- I doubt there are many others with a view that spectacular! The view of the bridge and opera house was incredible and really makes this hotel. The room itself was clean and had a kitchenette with everything that we needed to cook a few meals. The staff were friendly and helpful and let us leave our luggage with them all day on check out. The location was perfect- right in the middle of the fantastic Rocks. We could walk to all of the major sights within the area including the harbour, the Rocks, Botanical Gardens and CBD. We stayed on Sunday and Monday night- the price was MUCH higher later in the week but reasonable for our stay. The only issue we had was that a cockroach slithered infront of me in the bathroom but this was soon rectified by a brave boyfriend- I didn't think this was a huge issue, we were in Australia after all.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant find”
Reviews.Author: aussiechick3564
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out a very pleasant experience. We booked a suite and it was small but perfect, kitchenette, good work space, comfy bed and great shower the bathroom had pleanty of shelves and we felt we had tons of room. The pool although slightly warm for my tatse - I like my swimming water cold - was awesome. Only negative - skip the breakfast - it's typical manuafactured hotel food and there are tons of cafes in walking distance with fabulous food. The view from our balcony was amazing of the rocks and the bridge. It was within walking distance of evrything and very quiet at night. Will be staying here again and would reccomend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: chelseaboots61
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific stay at this hotel for our 4 days in Sydney. Being our first visit to the city we had no clue where to stay. The location was what made us choose The Rendezvous. It was perfect to explore the Opera House and surrounding area. We would take a ferry out to the zoo or beach each day. The hotel was close enough to come back to, on our return,before heading out for dinner. The room was clean and very comfortable. Loved how they combined old and modern together. We had a great view of the Opera House and the cruiseship we had arrived on. We decided to prepay for the breakfast buffet and we were happy we did. Saved having to find someplace for breakfast first thing in the morning. Buffet was typical for hotel breakfast buffet choices. Everything that was supposed to be hot was hot. Everything cold was cold. Comfortable table and chairs in the breakfast area. We did not use the pool and thought it would have been rather small if we were interested in it. I didn't travel all the way to Sydney to sit in a pool. The staff at the desk and in the breakfast room were friendly and very helpful. We did have trouble with the transportation as well. Staff member at desk had filled out one receipt for both of us. Driver was angry there wasn't 2 receipts one for each of us. During the drive to the airport he stopped to pick up more people. He didn't wait even a minute before he drove off again. I think they should consider changing shuttle company they recommend. We felt sorry for the hotel employee being so rudely treated by the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bet in Sydney Rocks”
Reviews.Author: The-Traveling-Snail
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to be in Sydney for her birthday. After deciding that we wanted to stay in the historic and walkable Rocks area, I researched practically every hotel in a half mile radius, I decided on the Rendezvous Stafford. This was probably one of the best decisions of our trip. The location was walkable to almost everything we wanted to do and see in Sydney. The hotel was very affordable, clean, and spacious. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and reasonably priced for the area. And the manager was both generous and gracious for my wife's birthday. An added bonus was the on-site laundry facilities. Oh, the views from the balcony are of the bridge and just the very tip of the opera house. There was nothing that could be improved upon. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: BigTraveller45
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were booked into the Rendezvous Stafford for 6 nights in September 2011. Upon check-in we had been put into a room on the second floor, without a balcony. I asked the front desk manager if there might be a room on a higher floor, with a balcony. He searched the availability and within a few minutes we were on the 4th floor, with a balcony room. We did not have a spectacular view, but we had not paid for a higher priced room, either. We were able to eat our breakfast on our balcony and enjoy the sunrise. I had made several requests to the front desk staff. At no time did I not receive excellent service. I did not encounter 1 staff member who was not professional at all times. Thanks, everyone, for a great stay. I can't imagine a hotel with a better location for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “OK, BUT !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: larascotts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a townhouse which has everything you need, lounge and kitchen/dining down stairs and bedroom and bathroom upstairs. A bit on the small side, (as townhouses are) this would only suit a couple. The house was right next to the road which was very busy so of course very noisy from traffic and pedestrians also the bed was very uncomfortable so we didn't sleep well at all. There was a build up of dust on the floor behind the front door and I found some lolly papers under the bedside table and beside the TV cabinet. I did not go looking for faults these things just stoodout, so I think the cleaning needs to be better. The staff just did there job, nothing extra. Great location, close to lot's of cafes, restaurants and pubs, short walk to the Quay and an easy walk into the city.

Reviews.Title: “A strange place to stay...but great location!”
Reviews.Author: travel_fan_aussie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a Sunday night treat as we were going to the zoo on Monday and wanted to be close to Circular Quay to catch the ferry. The main reason we booked was the location, and let me tell you it is damn near perfect. What wasn't good was the hotel itself - it didn't seem to know whether it wanted to be modern, or old & quaint. Our room was pretty soul-less overall but it had lovely old-school fireplaces and heavy wooden furniture in the bedroom. However the shower was from the 70s - literally, my parents had the exact same shower in the 70s - and it was very dark with not much natural light coming in. However the main issue we had was that we had booked a late checkout (1pm) and yet they called us at 12.15pm and asked when we were checking out. When I told them we had booked a late checkout, they told me we hadn't, and that we'd be charged an extra $50. I then said that we could be out in 10 mins so they waived the charge. Unfortunately I hadn't printed out our booking to show that we had actually booked the late checkout, but they were very inflexible. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again due to the pretty bad service and the strange vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Position”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Clean and spacious rooms. Useful kitchenette. A great central location in the middle of the iconic Rocks district.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and views!”
Reviews.Author: suem56
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at this hotel at The Rocks and the views were absolutely spectacular. We had a lovely balcony where we could sit and have our wine and intake the unobstructed views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The staff were pleasant and our room immaculately clean. The hotel is old but had everything we needed. The bathroom was also very clean. The breakfast was nice, a combination of cereals, muffins, various breads, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages, fresh fruits also. Parking prices were stiff at $45 per day (wilson parking). Overall, we all loved this hotel and would have no hesitation in recpmmending it. We walked to the Argyle Tavern and Pancakes on the Rocks and there were many pubs to choose from at arms length. This hotel would be a perfect one to stay at if you needed to stay in the city if leaving on a cruise from the Quay. :) Hotel prices were very reasonable for a hotel in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic views and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Agro_Sydney
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in a studio room on the 5th floor with a balcony and beautiful harbour views which included the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera house , the Rocks and the Sydney skyline. The studio had a large kitchen with 2 hotplates, microwave, mini bar, bar fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. The room was modern with a queen bed, flat screen LCD TV, large mirrored robe, desk, a small table and chairs. The small balcony had a small table and 2 chairs. The room was modern, bright and airy. The bathroom had a large mirror , vanity. toilet and a shower over the bath. The Hotel is located about 2 blocks back from Sydney harbour and a few doors from the Argyle Tavern and the heart of the Rocks. We got up early on Saturday morning for a easy walk around the Rocks Markets, shops and Sydney harbour foreshore. The Hotel is close to pubs, shops, markets and restaurants. Staff were friendly and gave excellent service from the time I booked the room til the time we checked out. Our hotel package included a buffet breakfast which included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, hash browns, muffins, fruit and cereal. The parking fee to park under the hotel was a bit steep at $45 a day but we paid this for the convenience as we were only staying one night. We enjoyed our stay and plan to stay at the hotel again. Though we stayed only one night, a couple could easily and comfortably stay in a studio room for a week's vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Get a new cleaner...”
Reviews.Author: Helen R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rendevous Stafford for 7 nights at the end of August with our 1.5 year old. The night we arrived we were shown to our room in the older part of the hotel, we were absolutely horrified at the level of un-cleanliness. There was a layer of dust around the edge of the room (I don't honestly know if anyone had ever vacummed around the edges). There was a layer of thick dust on many of the surfaces and crumbs etc in places. The bed was extremely old and uncomfortable - not to mention squeaky! The portacot the hotel provided was frankly disturbing!! The matress was approximately 1.5cm in thickness and was SO hard was like the poor child would have to sleep on a board - it liteally made a knocking noise when you hit it woth your hand. The remedy for the entire 7 nights was to give us a large blanket instead of a matress for our 1.5 year old to sleep on - less than ideal! There were lightbulbs out and the plugs for the sinks were covered on grime. The older part of the hotel is very noisy and the curtains moved n the breeze. We were upgraded to the newer part of the hotel from the second night and the room was a huge improvement. Had certainly been more thouroughly cleaned after our complaints about the first room. The bed was better as well. The cleaning staff left long black hairs everywhere (yeck!) and the cleaning was pretty average at best. The pool and front reception are lovely but they need to spend less time and money on first impressions and more time and money on maintaining cleanliness!! The hotel was close to all ameneties and within walking distance of most tourist attractions - don't take a rental car the parking is horrifically expensive and it is such a complicated system to understand. Although the second room was much more acceptable we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Past its use by date”
Reviews.Author: Rachel N
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?? This hotel is in major need of refurbishment - old, tired, scratched and stained fixtures and fittings throughout the room really detracted from the overall experience. The sofa bed was from 1960 and simply appalling - my guest had to move the mattress onto the floor in the end to prevent a back injury. There were no window covers on 2 windows into our suite that overlooked reception, so my guest (who had already moved her mattress onto the floor) was kept awake all night by the glaring lights from reception. Despite engaging with the hotel three times before arriving (specifically to prevent this situation arising) my guest was still charged a credit card fee on checking in. The hotel claimed they had no knowledge of any interaction with me. Air vents in the bathroom were full of hair and dust. The frame on the locked/unused, external door in the terrace house was an inch think with grime and dust. Finally, the late check out I arranged was disrupted by hotel staff banging on my door asking when I was leaving. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, however there are many other quality hotels located in the Rocks so I will be going elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “MIXED FEELINGS”
Reviews.Author: dari53
Reviews.Content: This is probably the strangest hotel ever stayed in. It is actually a townhouse with an upstairs. There were 4 of us, a double bedroom upstairs with a very good shower. The downstairs has a kitchen with a small kitchen table and then a small lounge with a window and door out onto the street (though you can't use this door - need to go through the hotel lobby). There is a nice pool. Did not eat here so can't comment., The major drawback were the beds provided for the other 2 adults. I don't know how we were to set up these beds - there was no room to do so. There was a sofa bed with an ancient and very uncomfortable mattress. In the end our two adult children slept on the floor upstairs! I only give it 3 stars because the location is first class. I doubt I would stay there again. It was extremely expensive. It is best really for only 2 people. Even though they say it sleeps 4, it doesn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: JoAnne F
Reviews.Content: We arrived early as most do from US flights and the staff was helpful in storing our luggage and giving us ideas of things to see closeby ,while we waited for our room to become available ( about 1pm!). We were thrilled to fall into bed and tickled that we could see the Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge from our hotel room window. It was a perfect location to see the major sites of Sydney on foot and our bus tour left from the Four Seasons Hotel, just down the street. We appreciated the free internet service. When we left ,also early in the morning, they called our late limo and pointed the way to coffee while we waited.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chichette10
Reviews.Content: Awesome location. All my requests were seen to promptly with very friendly staff. The room was very spacious, clean and tidy. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS place & people!”
Reviews.Author: Bobbs55
Reviews.Content: A great treat - nice, clean rooms, well outfitted kitchenette and a balcony from which you can see the Harbour Bridge! Friendly, helpful staff. Accompanied husband on business trip but we'll be back for pleasure. Highly recommended as a wonderful place from which to explore Sydney. Easy walking distance to bus, trains & ferries!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Turbogirl25
Reviews.Content: The staff here are lovely and really try hard to make your stay pleasurable. The rooms are clean and modern though not overly large. I haven't had much in the way of a view on either stay but it is quiet at night which is a bonus for light sleepers, particularly given its very convenient location in the heart of the Rocks. It is a 2 minute walk to Circular Quay ferries, 10 minute slow walk to the Opera House and there are lots of places to eat close by. Parking is downstairs though you pay around $45 for 24 hours if you pay through the hotel and considerably more if you pay via the parking provider. Don't do this if you are there on weekends though because the flat daily rate is only $15 a day so it is cheaper to just use the machine. There is a nice place in the hotel to eat breakfast which was included in the price and it had both hot and cold food included. There is also a great pool and a gym in the hotel. I like the location and the staff there and will certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable and good service”
Reviews.Author: DDFA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night wanting to be in The Rocks and close to Circular Quay. We managed to haul our suitcases to the hotel from the railway station and the staff were really accommodating - the breakfast was good, varied and plentiful and the restaurant adjoining the courtyard and pool area very pleasant. We had a studio room which was enormous and I guess the apartments on the upper floors would have a good view over the rooftops to the opera house etc. All in all a great place to stay and a very good rate for such a central hotel via one of the internet booking sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for a family”
Reviews.Author: DavidXO
Reviews.Content: Booked the one-bedroom apartment on the top floor, as this comfortably accommodated a family of five. Â Great location, great views and friendly staff. Â A nice little pool, too.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed at in my life.”
Reviews.Author: tms037
Reviews.Content: And that is an understatement. Checking-in with people who clearly knew limited English, my friend and I made our way to our rooms, carrying our own bags. The room itself looked very unwelcoming and was quite unpleasant. After 2 minutes inside, we noticed there was a very loud ventilation noise coming from the bathroom. This noise was not able to be turned off. When the bathroom door was shut, the noise was still unbearable. We decided to take a relaxing dip in the "outdoor heated pool and spa". Even the temperature in the spa was intolerable. How anybody could stand that is beyond me. Later we hoped into bed, and noticed there was no fitted sheet to the bed, and also no doona cover, but instead a sheet wrapped around a doona. We then had breakfast buffet in the morning. By the time we got down there, the food was cold and the drinks were warm, with no restocking in sight. Lucky this was complimentary. This is what I get for $200 a night? Very very very poor!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overall just ok”
Reviews.Author: Harlanc
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel in the Rocks is great. Very convenient to Circular Quay where you can catch the ferries and buses. Our room had a small kitchen with microwave, fridge, dishes and utensils so very good for eating in if you didn't feel like eating out everyday. The entire hotel needs a serious facelift. Our room was old and dated. The optional daily breakfast was ok with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and hash browns. Fresh melons and a variety of cold cereals and fruit juices. Their ad doesn't mention that they give guests 3 hours of free internet daily. It would have been nice to know that ahead of time so that I would have brought my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Six of the BEST for Sydney Stafford......”
Reviews.Author: dondenext
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but we loved the Stafford, and I'm sure we'll be back. In my opinion - Its the Best little Hotel in Sydney. Here's why:- 1.Best value for money. 2.Best location (The Stafford is in the charming Rocks area and within easy walking distance of Sydney's main Hub - Circular Quay) 3.Best staff, really polite and were always willing to help. 4.Best blend of original Rocks Architecture with new Hotel building and facilities. 5.Best choice of rooms (where else can you choose from a Victorian terrace house, a modern studio with kitchen, or an apartment?) 6.Best pool? (OK - so its not THE best pool in Sydney, but it is rather nice and it does have changing rooms and a jacuzzi) I could go on..... but, in short the Sydney Stafford is an ideal base for anybody to enjoy a visit to Sydney, avoid the faceless "mega chain" Hotels and stay somewhere that has a little bit of character. Its not Luxury by any means, but it is clean, comfortable and I would probably rate it as the best value for money hotel I've stayed in. Thank you Sydney Stafford. I hope Rendezvous Hotels appreciate you and your team as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: “Awe Inspiring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CaptainJack1
Reviews.Content: No more than a 5 minute walk from Centre Quays metro station. This Lovely Hotel is situated in the perfect spot in the Rocks Area. You can see the 2 world renowned Iconic sights, The Harbor Bridge & Opera House as well as live and breathe Sydney life. The rooms are great, Roomy with a kitchenette, well sized rest area, comfy beds and very clean. The staff are above and beyond on par. The could not do enough for us, polite, helpful and always courteous. The restaurant , pool area and lobby are always clean and the internet is available for a small charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: SarahS130
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our 6 day trip to Sydney. It is located in the heart of the 'Rocks' which made it very easy to get everywhere and we felt right in the centre of things. Having a kitchenette and sofa bed in the room in addition to the double bedroom made it perfect for our 4 person family and meant we saved on eating out all the time. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, the pool although small was a great hit with our children and I appreciated the free WiFi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Spacious Rooms for Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Whall21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rendevous for two nights during my stay in Sydney, and I really enjoyed my stay there. We originally booked the Historic Terrace House, we originally booked for - however, due to construction we were not able to stay in this room. While we were looking forward to staying in the room, the hotel was kind enough to give us a one bedroom room which was bigger than the terrace house. The rooms were nothing fancy, but they were spacious and comfortable enough. However, the location of the hotel was great. The hotel is situated just minutes away from the Opera House and many lovely shops/restaurants. I rate this hotel a 4 star for the great location, spacious rooms, and for the relatively low price for the rooms. Note: Parking is very expensive in Sydney. If you are planning on staying in this hotel, you do not need to rent a car. The hotel location is very convenient for all public transportation. If you do decide to park your car at the hotel, the cost is 45$ a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely apartment and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Brettsue
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Terrace House/apartment. It was cosy but ample big enough for the two of us. It was well equipped and in a great part of town - 15 minutes walk from the CBD and 2 minutes walk to lots of restaurants and markets and the harbour and historical sites etc. The staff were friendly and helpful and recommended economical options for dining etc. The pool was good (very warm!) and the free wifi was really useful. We loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: Sparkle59
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to be down by the Rocks and harbour. Hotel rooms large, clean but dated. We paid for extra bed which I might add was the worse bed I have ever slept in - they really need to update them. The views from our balcony apartment were fantastic, I will insert photos of what we saw, harbour bridge and opera house!!! excellent. Didnt use pool but looked nice. A world to the reception staff, when clients walk in or out from their rooms it would be very nice if you looked up from what ever you are doing (and it was never busy) and say good morning or good evening - not once did this happen over our stay - makes the clients feel special and want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: rpciordia
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location! Very friendly staff that was helpful from check-in to check-out. Excellent views of the harbour and Opera House from our room (when not blocked by passenger ships). Rooms were very adequate with kitchen. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sniggs
Reviews.Content: We also were boarding a cruise ship so chose something close ,still thought we would have to catch a taxi but it was an easy stroll to Circular Key . We loved the Rendezvous , the veiw from 6th floor was amazing . Many eating places at the door step . We found the staff to be extremelly helpful and very happy with our room ,highly reccomend it

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the best location for exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TimothyLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to the harbour with views of the Opera House from our window. There are lots of restaurants around and easy access to public transport. The main shopping street is a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: sailregmel
Reviews.Content: We were going on a cruise and this hotel is just 2 blks to the Overseas passenger terminal so it was the perfect location for us. I reserved a harbor view studio room and requested a balcony. The room had the view I was hoping for and was in walking distance to all of the harbor attractions. The furnishings were older but so what. If they upgrade this hotel you would probably have to pay double and everything is expensive enough in Sydney and all of Australia. Employees at reception were very plesant. I did not eat breakfast at the hotel or use the pool. Perfect place to spend a night or 2 pre cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly staff with a flexible attitude.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerUKenglish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 17 nights in Jan/Feb, the service at check in was friendly. We were initially placed in a room without a balcony, we asked for a balcony and possibly a harbour view, the lady on reception had a few words with her manager, and without any hassle this request was fine. The room was quite dated as has been reported in other reviews, it had a kitchenette, bathroom (with French Connection toiletries, which was nice), and the requested balcony, the datedness didn't bother me one bit due to the priceless view we had of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. If you travel with a laptop / iPad or iPod, you get a code that gives you 3 hours of free wifi access per day. Any issues or questions I had, was dealt in a prompt fashion. The location is within a short walking distance of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Circular Quay rail and ferry links on the harbour and also a pleasant stroll away from the city centre/CBD. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: bukilester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in Jan 2011. Hotel is quite small, but well presented. Reception staff were friendly, although had one bad experience one evening with not being let in after hours as the receptionist said he couldn't hear us pressing the buzzer in the office, took 20 mins with finger on button constantly to finally get in! Had a apartment style room, nice size. Cleanliness was ok.. not brilliant. The sofa being the biggest let down.. lots os stains......... room was quite dusty too and the towels were stained with what looked like hair dye one day! Location is excellent in the rocks, 2 mins was to Circular Quay/ Opera House and Bridge. (A great shop opposite, Harbour Rocks Gifts).

Reviews.Title: “'View from the Top'”
Reviews.Author: Swallow11
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night after two long flights from the UK and were made more than welcome when we arrived by the friendly and efficient reception staff. I had requested a room with a balcony, but unfortunately they only had this type of room availabile for 2 nights of our stay. But, they did come up with a solution for a small fee they would move us in to a suite for the last two nights of our stay. The deal was done and wasn't it worth it, the views over Sydney harbour bridge and the opera house were stunning. The hotel is a little tired as other reviewers have said, the location is the best, for all the sightseeing, bars. trips you could want for. A stones throw away there are plenty of bars, restaurants, cafes, shops. These will cater for all your needs from breakfast to dinner. I have to say that we found all the locals amazingly friendly and helpful, thank you. It is really worth doing your homework for booking this hotel as the prices vary massively from company to company. A great hotel in the right spot

Reviews.Title: “Better than hoped”
Reviews.Author: dandtgeddes
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay in the Rocks district for one night and wanted to keep the family together, so an apartment style set up worked really well for us. We had a one bedroom apartment that overlooked the street, some street noise, but not much. No worse than a suburb. Although we had a kitchen with appliances, crockery and cutlery, we really only used the coffee and tea making facilities. The staff were fabulous and very helpful. Based on some of the reviews I had seen we almost cancelled our stay, glad we didn't. The place was clean, the facilities were tidy and the toiletries were lovely. Our luggage was stored at no extra cost, the staff brought to our attention that breakfast was cheaper if we pre-ordered and the location was incredible. Breakfast was hearty with lots of variety. The free wi-fi was an unexpected bonus! Overall a tidy place that family on a budget can enjoy and be in easy walking distance to many of the attractions in the Sydney city centre and wharf areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value for money in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Bongo_Craigy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and thought the location was excellent for first time visitors to Sydney. The room was nice, clean and had everything we needed. We found the staff friendly and helpful. The pool was very very cold and the pool area a little basic but then we weren't planning on spending any time at the pool anyway. As a base to see Sydney this is a great hotel without blowing the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms if you pay the price”
Reviews.Author: munro1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom apartment with 2 balconies and 1 with harbour views. Good points: â€¢ Location, close to station, ferries, good restaurants, museum, harbour side. â€¢ Stylish decor in room and reception â€¢ Nice pool but seemed much smaller than advertised online â€¢ Good service but depends on time of the day * Very quiet â€¢ Good beds and pillows â€¢ Extra sofa bed in case of friends crashing â€¢ Good facilities in shower and kitchen Bad points â€¢ Room smelt musty but otherwise clean â€¢ We had no problem checking in but in the morning a fire alarm went off and they kept on announcing "Emergency, everyone stay in their rooms". We were going to do that anyway but why announce it 50 times and leave the speaker on so we can hear the staff discussing nonsense and what to do about the seemingly nonexistent fire.. That was really annoying and when we went down to check out an hour later after their announcements, the staff were just idling around with no idea of where the fire was. They didn't seem to know what was happening and waited around with the firemen. We also waited about 45 minutes for them to check us out. But otherwise the other man who checked us in seemed much more professional. If you pay for a crappy room I'm sure you WONT get a nice view at all and it would be both musty and dark. Location wise, this is the only thing going for it if you want a cheaper room.

Reviews.Title: “last day spoilt-great pity”
Reviews.Author: lichfield2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel and were really impressed with the location and standard of accomadation.We booked ,with the hotel,transportation to the airport.Having checked 3 times that everything was ok we waited in the reception for our transport.Unfortunately it did not arrive.The problem we had was we had saved only enough money to pay the coach company.The hotel could not explain why the transport had not arrived and recomended a taxi.Things went from bad to worse along with our remaining money.It was a pity the staff did not know how to deal with the situation in a more professional way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - excellent views!”
Reviews.Author: Gaz_n_Gill
Reviews.Content: fortunately we had a personal recommendation for this hotel - if we had relied on the reviews we might not have risked it! True, it wasn't luxury accommodation - but our research showed we would have had to pay alot more for that in this good a location. We never intended to spend much time in our room other than sleeping - it was a base from which to explore the city, & for that it was perfect (although waking up to a view of The Opera House was great!) It was so nice to be able to pop back to our room whenever we needed to without wasting time or money on transport costs. Our only minor complaint was that the pool area didn't seem to get much sun - but that wasn't what we were there for anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DianaMariaLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fabulous location - so near the bridge, transport, restaurants etc. but our studio apartment was a disappointment. We had no balcony which we thought most of the rooms had and only one of the windows could be opened with one of those wind up fixtures which opened out to about 6 inches. The room was dark at the back of the building so there was no view. The kitchen facilities were basic. Also the sheets on our bed were torn which I found a bit depressing! I would recommend for the location but for the price I think it could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gillian32
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Stafford with my daughter on the final leg of our whistle stop tour of the east coast of Australia. The hotel is in a prime location and is really central when sightseeing in Sydney. The hotel staff were really helpful. It was raining when we first arrived. The receptionist recommended a nearby restaurant and even allowed us to borrow an umbrella for the duration of our holiday. Our luggage was damaged on out flight and the staff helped with the repair. Our stay in this hotel was the perfect end to a lovely holiday

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: scorpio001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Rocks - such a convenient location, just 5 minutes walk from the harbour, with views of the Bridge, Circular Quay and the Opera House. Good restaurants are also nearby. The Tourist Office is also within a 5 minute walk. Our apartment-style room was great and there is an all-night supermarket at the end of the street - a bit pricey, but convenient. (The internet access, with web-cams, is cheaper at the supermarket, than in the hotel) The staff were all very polite and welcoming, and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: IndustryBuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner while he was on business, so I had the opportunity to spend a bit of time by myself while out and about. While it did meet my general requirements, it wasn't by any means as good as it could possibly be. There was some definite advantages - the location was perfect, the foyer and pool were lovely and, as a general rule the staff were very friendly. However, there was room for improvement. When we made the booking we specifically asked for a room with a balcony, which we didn't get. The batteries died in our remote, the beds were very poorly made, there were no bathrobes, there was no 'Do Not Disturb'/'Please make my room' sign in our room, and there was no dinner service whatsoever. And one one day, getting back from being out and about at 5pm, our room had not been made. Mentioning it to the Front Office they mentioned that they had been busy - however, this is really no excuse. Ultimately Sydney is a very compeditive market for hotels. Should I should choose to come back to Sydney, I would definitely choose to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LanaWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Studio Room with a Harbour View. Room was really nice with kitchen facilities and a really nice bathroom. I was disappointed we did not get a balcony as on the website there was a picture of one. We enquired at reception and they said some Studio Rooms had them but they had to be requested when booking. So there's my tip....make sure you request a balcony. Love how it is tucked away off the main streets. Rendezvous is in the perfect position close to lots of resturants, ferry's, trains, convenience store on the corner, Tourist Information Centre 40-50 metres away. Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb (where you start) so close and when walking there discovered a lot of new pub's, resturants that were tucked away. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: zekenz
Reviews.Content: We went to Sydney to see a concert and wanted to be close to the Opera House so we could walk back to our room after the concert without too much effort. We found the hotel exactly where we wanted to be. We were right in The Rocks area with cobbled streets, museums and lots of nice places to eat. A short walk to the entrance to the Harbor Bridge (all stairs so you may need to be a little fit) and another short walk (5mins) to get to Circular Quay with plenty of restaurants, the Opera House and the bus/train station. There is a convenience store on the corner where we were able to get all the things to self cater our breakfast and snacks. The room was large with a balcony that had a view of the city and harbor. The kitchen had everything we needed, toaster, fridge, jug as well as pots and pans, microwave etc... The room was decorated bright, modern and tastefully. It was nice to have the balcony to sit out and take in the view (and a few glasses of bubbly) and I am not sure if all the rooms are as nice as ours but we were so happy with the location and this hotel is priced well for where it is so anything we weren't as happy with(waiting for staff to come to desk at check in and check out) we could look past.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: oks943idk4
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be fine - not great and not bad. It is in a fantastic location (The Rocks) so if you want something functional and well located, this is a good choice. The staff were very pleasant. The room I stayed in (a studio) was a good size but the bathroom did feel cramped. Still, everything was clean and serviced every day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: MsLea
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay in the Rocks in Sydney this is a great hotel. The room was an apartment with stove and dishes so some meals could be prepared in the room. Not that this is needed. There are plenty of places to eat nearby. Internet was pricey at the hotel but cheap at the store on the corner. Desk staff wasn't all that helpful. Location is close to circular quay station, Opera House and Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “What a Joke”
Reviews.Author: shagga66
Reviews.Content: Well, where do I start, I booked 3 months out and was told that I had an apartment that included balcony overlooking the opera house and views of the bridge. After arriving there I was told that I should of been informed that the room I was meant to have was "subject to availability" guess what ? it wasn't available. I was also told the there was car parking available. Well there was at a cost of $45 per night, thats if you left it there, if you wanted to drive it out it was $35 after 2 hours, I was there one night and spent $80 on parking. Now for the room, I was given my card and made my way up to a small dirty and dark room. My kids after the long drive need to go to the toilet, after they had finished it was clear that the toilet didn't work. When I mentioned this to the front desk they asked if I checked the water was on..."Should I check" I told him. I think he should of just said he would fix it. The air con vent on the low roof looked like it was going to fall off, the paint looked old and faded and the view that I might of had out the window would of been ok if the windows weren't so dirty. I went down to tell them that I would be leaving and they told me that I would be better off staying for one night as they would be charging me for it anyway. So I convinced my wife to stay the one night and the bed was lumpy and uncomfortable. I checked out and left the next morning NEVER too return. Then spent the next few hours looking for more accommodation. This place was a total joke and they should not be in business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Vancana
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel has to be its biggest attraction. Right in the heart of The Rocks, minutes from Circular Quay, Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, it's sight seeing central. We found the staff to be very pleasant, the room to be spacious, and being on the 4th floor, room 414 I think, we had a large patio that offered a splendid view of the bridge. However, the bathroom was a bit dated, and plumbing noises from other rooms were audible. We didn't eat in the hotel, with the abundance of restaurants nearby it wasn't necessary, and we found the Rock Cafe on George Street served a very good breakfast. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney for New Year but it costs!”
Reviews.Author: DizLondon
Reviews.Content: A lovely friendly and boutique style hotel right in the heart of the Rocks literally minutes away from Circular Quay, the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House. We stayed here after Christmas for New Year's Eve and we were not disappointed after very poor accommodation before this in Airlie Beach. The rooms were very spacious and clean although it seems they have upgraded some parts and not others. The kitchen units seemed quite old but it wasn't a real problem. However, you're not going to be spending much time indoors when there is so much to see and do in Sydney and The Rendezvous Stafford is in an ideal location to give you access to every sight and attraction. The only problem was the ridiculous cost of the rooms but I suppose what do you expect over that time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: MissDMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rendezvous for two nights in two different rooms. The first room had an amazing view of Sydney Opera House but the room was quite disgusting (we had to ask for our bedsheets to be changed as soon as we got there) and the bathtub and shower were one so it was difficult taking a shower. The second room we stayed in was a Terrace room which was quite charming and did not seem as filthy although the bathroom situation was the same. The service was absolutely terrible right from the beginning from every staff member. They were unbelievably neglectful and seemed to be a bit demented when giving us directions to somewhere. Breakfast was ridiculously overpriced for a continental breakfast (we had decided to have breakfast assuming the hotel provided cooked breakfast especially for the price but to our dismay we found it was nothing more than toast, cereal and jam). Overall, the location was good, the pool seemed quite nice although it was too cold to use it. However, the place is completely overpriced and the bad service will ruin your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: roddle
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Friendly staff, big rooms, harbour views. Have stayed in other hotels in the area costing twice as much but the location is perfect, the hotel clean and comfortable. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nistock
Reviews.Content: My third time in Sydney--this time for my daughter's wedding. Four years ago my family had rooms in the York apartments. Two years ago my partner and I stayed in the Observatory hotel, for which I have nothing but praise. This time I was staying longer and I needed somewhere slightly cheaper but just as convenient. The Stafford Rendezvous was right up to expectation. The rooms were big and well equipped. The staff were friendly and efficient. The location can not be faulted and the overall value is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff...”
Reviews.Author: highbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Harbour view Studio for three nights and LOVED it!! We had some flight difficulties and had to send our 20 year ol d son to Sydney ahead of us. The staff was great and held his bags for him until we arrived so that he could go out and enjoy the city. When we checked in we were greeted by Jacob who was extremely pleasant, helpful and kind.....he promptly greeted us with a smile and great service. During our 3 day stay we were treated wonderfully by other front desk staff members, Simone and Matty. They gave us good and helpful tourist information and went above and beyond to provide bus info, restaurant suggestions and weather reports!!!!! The hotel is wonderfully situated across the street from the Harbour rocks Hotel. Literally a 5 minute walks to all major attractions in the rocks district. Hotel lobby is small but sleek, fresh apples always available ,and a clean small spa area. Room was large enough for our family of 3, although our son complained a bit about the pull out twin bed...our queen size bed was quite comfortable. Fully equipped studio kitchen with coffee and tea provisions, dishes, wine glasses and micro wave. We had a wonderful and stunning view of the Harbor overlooking the opera house and Harbor Bridge...two days later a cruise ship measuring about 6 city blocks docked right outside!!!!! This is not hotel's fault but be prepared to have your view blocked if you travel during high season..This was one of the most pleasant hotels where I have stayed on vacation in quite some time..I would certainly recommend this hotel if you like something that is different than a standard Marriott or Hyatt which would give you the feel that you could be anywhere..we FELT like we were in Sydney while here and wouldn't hav traded our experience for anthing!!!! This was not a luxury hotel but a cool, upscale boutique hotel with charm..hope we can go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: justdancey
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel I asked if I could switch rooms and the staff were ever so accommodating and friendly. My room had a beautiful view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Nothing could be more perfect. The staff have been extremely friendly and helpful everyday. I was able to check-in early and check-out late!! I will book this hotel again when I come back in the Fall and I have already recommended it to several people I work with. Absolutely fabulous location and amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: hkoyster
Reviews.Content: This is nothing special.. actually.. i have some remarks on it. We asked for a harbour view studio. We paied more for this and we had a small apt with with windows on the harbour. what a pity there are buildings in front. So no view of the sea, no view of the opera (only small parts of the top). Location is pretty good, instead. This hotel is in The Rocks and that can be a good idea if you come in Sydney on weekends. The area is quiet as well. Rooms are large. Kitchen is fully equipped. Be aware on the steps to go to bathroom and to kitchen. As small as dangerous for your feet.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Rawrachel
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a long haul flight to be greeted by an incompetent, flustered and ultimately rude and unhelpful front desk receptionist. Check in never happened and we moved on as quickly as we could. Shame, as reading reviews from 6 months ago this hotel got the thumbs up however it would appear that there has been a change of personnel throughout the hotel in recent months. At the time we were there there was no hotel manager in position! and this well located spot is rapidly going down hill. I suggest you look elswhere for accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear!”
Reviews.Author: kiwibear
Reviews.Content: The location was great, right near the Rocks which would have been handy if the market was on. The entrance looked good but the receptionist kept us waiting a while as she chatted to a guest about places to go. We were tired and found this bad manners. The lobby was cheap and the room was disappointing. We had expected a groovy, unusual but trendy place judging by the cleverly taken photos which we saw on Trip Advisor but instead it was a tired and grubby room and bathroom. We didnt bother with the continental breakfast on offer as there were multiple choices of eateries nearby. There was a pool which was tiny, outdoors and cold therefore unusable. The 'Rockpool' was a wonderful eating experience and a great find just round the corner and the only good thing about our stay at the Rendezvous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent tourist location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: pbridge1300
Reviews.Content: For a tourist, I found this to be an excellent location, at a reasonable price. Ten minutes' walk to circular quay (a little bit of uphill, and perhaps twenty stairs in the middle of that walk, if stairs are an issue for one). Five minutes' walk to the circular quay cruise ship terminal, and a stroll along the harbour. Twenty minutes' walk to the opera house. Easy access for a walk across the bridge. This is not a grand hotel, but it's a perfectly pleasant small hotel, with a small but welcoming lobby, and an almost-boutiquey feel. The front desk staff were a bit harried and over-worked, usually solo and handling multiple customers, but were pleasant and professional. Our room was the least expensive available, and overlooked a courtyard and adjacent rooftops, not bad since the adjacent rooftops are classic tile, on vintage buildings. We did not have a "view", nor did we expect one , given the reasonable price we paid. The room was pretty generous in size. The bathroom was maybe a bit tight, but it was acceptable. Every room has an adequately-equipped kitchenette, and we had breakfast in before heading out for the day. Nice to be able to have a strong cup of coffee (there was a small French press provided), and toast and jam, for pennies, and then a second cup for a few pennies more. One evening when my wife was tired we heated soup in the room. It's certainly pleasant to have the option. By the way, we did not find a food shop in the neighborhood, but relied on large grocery stores that we came across in other areas. We did not use in-house food service, or parking, so cannot comment on those. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiring to find and stay”
Reviews.Author: Tconnisor
Reviews.Content: This Hotel whilst quite cheap is simply you get what you pay for, it was like a 3 star hotel trying to be a 4 star. Rooms were tired, and not spotlessly clean, staff had NO idea what was going on and the hotel location is liturally a hole in the wall. However...it did have a VERY nice pool area, shame it backed on to the glass walled restaurant, for people eating to have a good perve at the pool patrons. I guess it would be ok for families but for business travel where time and convienience is an issue - stay at an international chain

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, stunning city”
Reviews.Author: wayulooktonige
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stafford for six nights as part of our honeymoon. Our travel agent had booked a self catering apartment with a harbour view. The room was drab. The general cleanliness did not encourage us to make our meals there. There was a pervading musty smell. It reminded me of holiday flats I'd spent my childhood holidays in back in the 1970s in Blackpool and Skegness! The view of the harbour was very limited. It looks spectacular on the official shot - this I presume is the view from the floor above. During our stay, another two guests were given room keycards that were programmed for our room. Luckily, we were in at the time when they entered our room and therefore avoided an unlikely but nonetheless potential security issue. There was a vague apology from the lady on reception who passed the blame on to another colleague. The other two members of staff we met were more courteous and helpful. The city is amazing however. We couldn't really have been better located. The Rocks is well worth strolling around for hours. The Circular Quay and Darling Harboour are magnificent, along with the Botanical Gardens and the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Best All Round Value Downtown "User Friendly Location" Convenience”
Reviews.Author: SafetyHarbor
Reviews.Content: For anyone who wishes to have a downtown base, there is no better place to stay than here. I have stayed here on a number of occasions previously with family members, and individually. Everything to everywhere is within a few minutes leisurely stroll, trains buses ferries, opera house,downtown, shopping. There is a small convenience store at street level for all last minute needs. There is a great street market set up Friday and Saturday that is located just down the street where you can find everything from local produce to handcrafts. The hotel itself has gone through some changes over the 15 years I have stayed there, but is by far the most convenient value for money location in Sydney. Family friendly, with kitchen facilities, guest laundry, only six floors high with a million dollar view and location, clean rooms friendly staff, and far less of an impersonal clinical feel of the larger hotels. From Sydney Airport get a cab, the shuttles are painfully slow and take up to 1 1/2 hours, the cab takes 25 min and cost no more for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Rocks district, LOCATION +++”
Reviews.Author: KIWITRAVELLERS343
Reviews.Content: Just returned form a 2 night stay, great room, contemporary and very clean. Fantastic location, just a short 5 minute walk from Circular Quay, and The Rocks with all the restaurants and bars are right on your door step. Considering this factor the rooms were very quiet. We even had a sky line view of the opera house. The room s have a small kitchen for making breakfast and snacks in. Although our deal with the hotel included breakfast, nothing flash, but hey what do you need. We got bacon, scrambled eggs, pastries, toast, fresh fruit and juice, cereal and yogurt. Certainly enough to set you up for a busy day of sight seeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UWECSARAH
Reviews.Content: We were only in Sydney for 48 hours, so we wanted to make the best of it! We chose to stay in The Rocks area because it's so central to all the activites we wanted to do. The Rendezvous seemed to be a perfect match to what we were looking for. We arrived early in the morning (9am) - well before check-in time. The front desk allowed us to drop off our bags & let us know to check back in a few hours to see if our room was ready. We wandered around for a bit (everything is within walking distance!) and when we came back 90 minutes later our room was ready. We had opted for an upgraded room that gave us a view of the Opera House. The view wasn't the greatest, but we could see the Opera House the first day. On day two a cruise ship came in & blocked it. The room was very big. We had a small kitchen, which was nice! We didn't rent a car, so I don't know if parking is available or not at the hotel. We walked to the Bridge Climb, Pancakes on the Rocks (yummy!), Opera House, and the Fortune of War Pub (oldest Pub in Sydney). The hotel did have a breakfast option. I believe we paid $12.50 AUS each. It was nothing special, but decent. We used the hotel's computers a few times. You buy blocks of time. We never had a problem getting on a computer. The front desk staff helped arrange for a transfer to the airport the night before our departure. I wish Sydney were closer so that we could visit more often!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, brilliant hotel with a cool, friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: tiggerandpooh
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED staying here! The Stafford has the feel of an urban retreat, with an intimate atmosphere. The staff are lovely and very cool, and will do anything to help.
