Unlike the corporate impersonal feeling that so many hotels in big cities do, the Stafford has a really relaxed intimate atmosphere, a bit like a trendy health spa. The location in the good-looking old colonial area of The Rocks is AMAZING: 3 minute walk to Circular Quay and a further 7 min walk around the quay to the Opera House and Botanic Gardens. It's about a 20min walk up to the Pitt Street Shopping Mall. There is also a Coles Supermarket about a 20min walk away if you want to self cater. At the weekend there is The Rocks markets virtually outside your door. Restaurants and cafes and trendy shops are in abundance on the doorstep. We stayed in a studio apartment on the first floor (the breakfast room is below so if you like a lie-in opt for a room on a higher floor). It was decorated in a boutique hotel style with a bright red feature wall and big flat screen TV and stylish furniture. The kitchen was basic but well equipped for 2, with a halogen hob and a microwave oven and a mid size fridge. There is also a kettle, a toaster and free coffee and Twinings Teas. The room had a big, mirrored double wardrobe with a chest of drawers and a sturdy safe inside. You can have your room serviced everyday and will be given fresh towels everday too if you wish. The room had a little cobweb here and there, and the corners had been neglected by the vacuum, and although the grout in the bathroom was a bit grotty the standard of the room was good and it felt clean and fresh. The cleaning staff are also lovely and extremely helpful. The corridors outside the roomsare a bit drab and need renovating, which is at odds with the very funky and newly decorated look of the rest of the hotel. The reception area is lovely with funky oversized mirrors and lamps, free newspapers and comfy sofas. This leads off to a small trendy internet lounge with 2 computers ($5.50 for half an hour) and 2 comfy sofas. Very cosy! There is also a small but well equipped gym. Towels, water and a CD payer for your own music is provided. This area then leads onto the groovy breakfast room (breakfast is $15.50 per person and includes bacon, egg, cereal, juice, tea, etc). The style is modern 70s chic, with oval indonesian chairs and funky wood veneers. When breakfast is closed you can still hang out in the breakfast room which looks out onto the pool area, and help yourself to free capuccino, latte, etc. There is also free water from the cooler which is great if you're lounging by the pool. The pool leads off the breakfast room, which can open its doors right out onto the pool area. It's not a huge pool but is perfect for having fun or exercising, and is very clean and very, very warm. Clean towels are provided. There are 4 loungers with side-tables by the pool and a cushioned area to sit on around the jacuzzi. There is also an outdoor covered area with tables and chairs for relaxing with a drink if you fancy it. We often saw guests chilling out there with a bottle of wine or a (free) coffee at night. The hotel really promotes an atmosphere of "feel right at home", which we certainly did! Great hotel, beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Brits_Abroad77
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel primarily for it's proximity to the Harbour Bridge and The Rocks, that it also had large, well presented rooms was a big bonus. We found the staff to be friendly and professional, and the reception desk was always staffed. Rooms were quiet, clean and luxurious. There was a small gym and a decent sized pool and spa. Downsides - the pool was cold while we were there and the sauna not working, the mini bar prices looked especially pricey. Best bits - the location.

Reviews.Title: “Management have bad attitude. Great location. Harbour views sometimes blocked.”
Reviews.Author: Imagine95
Reviews.Content: Grossly dissapointed with bad attitude of management, with the exception of the night receptionist ,Blake, was very courteous. Great central location. Have stayed many times previously and every room I have previously stayed in has had a balcony and a harbour view. . Have recommended hotel to many overseas friends, never again. Latest stay 9th Feb 09. When I arrived the hotel had no reservation, turns out it had erroneously been made for 9th Feb (perhaps my mistake or perhaps the booking company) and I was charged for that date as a "no show" as well as being charged for this past stay. The manager and day receptionist were very rude and showed no understanding that it was a genuine error. They said they had been totally booked all February, which seems odd when they advertized empty rooms on Wotif.com all month. Then to add insult to injury they gave me a "harbour view room" with the view totally blocked by a tree and no balcony. When I asked to change they charged me an additional $60 to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: marylizowen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a girls weekend break. Great location and a good choice for a city break. Room was fine- didn't get the balcony but there was a little kitchen and all that you need. Roll away bed for the 3rd person was very uncomfortable though and since we paid an extra $70 would expect a better standard of bedding- my friend had to take the mattress off and sleep on the floor as the springs were sinking in the middle. Pool area was fine but be aware that there's no sun on it at all as it's on the ground floor. Hotel is in a great location- so central to everything and having the parking was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, super friendly staff and what a service!! :)”
Reviews.Author: geddi
Reviews.Content: Check-in: We were met by a very friendly lady at check in. After the check in was finished she asked us if this was our honeymoon trip. We confirmed and she congratulated us and informed us that we could choose any wine from the minibar complimentary from the hotel. She also gave us an envelope that contained free breakfast vouchers for the whole stay and a congratulation card. What a welcome!! Bravo!! Room: We stayed in a studio room on 4th floor with balcony. No harbour and Opera house view. Could only see the top of the Opera house. A decent size room with a comfortable bed, sofa group and table and a kitchen. The room was in good condition. Ok sized and clean, tiled bathroom. Location: Fantastic!! Just minutes walk away from Opera house, Circular quay and harbour bridge. Plenty of restaurants, pubs and cafes in the area. Overall impression: For the price we paid I must say this was super good value with is's unbeatable location (Four seasons, Hyatt and Shangri-la are all located in this area) and super friendly staff. The breakfast is nothing to rave about, but since we got it for free that didn't bother us. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but be forewarned”
Reviews.Author: onehipdad
Reviews.Content: Ok, believe all the raves and kudos about the location, they're true. the BridgeClimb is a five-minute walk, ferries and trains likewise. The two oldest pubs in Sydney are minutes away, and very nice restaurants & shopping are close, too. Room was small, but we had a full kitchen and did most of our dinners there. Downside, the sofabed was tortuous, we had to purchase a rollaway to put that mattress on the sofabed for some degree of comfort. Internet is $13.00 for a two hour block, $65 for 10 hours(!). Now, we stayed here in August for 7 nights: I was allowed to use Choice points for just three nights and had to pay for four: $314 for Sunday, $410 for each of the other three nights (there were three of us in the room). All done thru the Choice rewards program, confirmed when we arrived and settled when we checked out. In mid-December, a charge of $426AUD showed up on our credit card bill courtesy of the hotel. After three calls to the hotel and promises from them to e-mail us an explanation which we never received, we finally were told that our Choice points had not been redeemed thus they were taking the funds from us. One call to Choice got it straightened out, and we were told to expect a credit and a letter of apology from the hotel. We got the credit but have yet to receive the apology, either by letter or e-mail. I had a week of business in Melbourne the week previous, and apparently there's a belief and acceptance in Australia that the internet is a real moneymaking enterprise. We did find a coffee shop in the Rocks about 10 minutes away that had a hotspot but limited hours of operation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: NCTakesOnTheWorld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about location, and we loved it! Good value, especially for being in a place where we could walk to so many points of interest (opera house, bridge, quay, restaurants, bars, and more!). Our patio had a great view, too, of the bridge. The room was very comfortable and clean, and we loved having the kitchen since we were on a 3week vacation. We also used the gym and the Internet access--- very nice amenities to have. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & a great view”
Reviews.Author: Cardiff2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it is in the Rocks area of the city â€“ where there are quite a few restaurants and bars. It is an attractive hotel which is well-maintained and very clean. Our first room (on a lower floor) was adequate, if a bit gloomy as there wasnâ€™t much natural light due to surrounding buildings. We moved to the top floor, which was excellent. It was large, with a separate bedroom and lounge area, and the view is great â€“ with the opera house right in front of you, and the harbour bridge to your left. In fact, it was so nice that we spent most of one sunny day on the terrace, finding it hard to tear ourselves away. The hotel is distinctively and attractively furnished, though it must be said it does look a tiny bit worn here and there in public areas. Theyâ€™ve squeezed in a pool, which was closed for maintenance when we were there. Staff members were friendly and efficient. Although itâ€™s in a busy area, the hotel itself is peaceful and quiet. It seemed to be a hotel popular with couples, as we saw no children there. One small irritation is the policy on wi-fi. You have to pay A$13+ per 2 hours. This may be fine if you donâ€™t need to be online several times a day, otherwise this can add up to a lot during your stay. Frankly, it is a skinflint policy and a Big Black Mark against the hotel. We had received complimentary wi-fi in some other hotels before arriving here. Surely, complimentary wi-fi will be the norm soon. If you arenâ€™t inclined to pay it go to the Custom House by the nearby train station & log on free on the second floor of the public library. In summary, the Rendezvous is a well-located, good quality hotel with a fantastic view from the top floor. Pay the extra â€“ itâ€™s worth it â€“ but take a short walk rather than pay their silly wi-fi prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: JimmyandHeather
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a three week trip around Australia. When we first arrived in Sydney we stayed at the Marriot Sydney Harbour which we were not overly impressed with other than its prime location on Circular Quay. We felt it was way over priced whereas The Rendevous is also well located in the historic (but actually a bit boring ??) Rocks area and only cost us half as much. (We booked both through British Airways) Our room here was twice as big as the one we had in The Marriot and it had a well equipped Kitchenette and it was just as nice. It's only a 5 minute walk to Circular Quay and if we ever return to the beautiful harbour city of Sydney we would definitely stay here again, We find it hard to believe other guests had a bad experience - still there you go?

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: vapourider
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find. Location was in the rocks area, on a not very busy street. It was half a block away from a convenience store and a coffee shop and lots of local tourist sites and shopping. Also a few minutes walk to Circular Quay and links to the whole city. The modern studio room was more like a spacious studio apartment with a sitting area and a large fully equipped kitchenette. The staff was very polite and helpful, taxis arrived as requested, restaurant recommendations,etc. I could stay day or a month, overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Rocks rock!”
Reviews.Author: bettrnettr
Reviews.Content: The Rendezvous was a fantastic hotel. It is in the heart of "The Rocks", which is definitely the most interesting part of Sydney. This hotel is also walking distance to The Sydney Harbor Bridge, The Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay (the central ferry station) and a train Station. It is also walking distance to the Bus Stops for the beginning of the Sydney Explorer and Bondi Explorer buses. Our room was a nice size with a big, fully stocked kitchenette. The staff was very attentive and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is in Sydney for the first time and wants to be walking distance to a lot of fun sites.

Reviews.Title: “Another Unsatisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: sendingaloha
Reviews.Content: I just read another review that was very similar to our BAD experience. So I thought I'd add mine here too. They gave us a hassle at check-in because they couldn't find our reservation so we were put in a sub-standard room. The bed was so lumpy and the sheets were rough and itchy. The pillows stunk! There was visible mold on the walls. The street noise was really loud and since we were only on the 2nd floor even closing the window didn't help. The next day we checked into the Marriott (which has a very nice location) and we were able to get a much better room for $10.00 cheaper. They tried to charge us for a second night because of a two night minimum but I was able to fight ithem with my credit card company and I won. I am writing this review to warn everyone about this hotel. There are so many other options in Sydney in the same price range. I have no idea why anyone would want to stay at this horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jauntie
Reviews.Content: Two days before we were scheduled to arrive I called to confirm my reservations and was assured that I was confirmed with a room for three nights. Imagine our surprise when after a 12 hour flight and 35 minute cab ride we arrived at the hotel only to be told that we had no reservation. After about 20 minutes they said they could give us a room and by that time we were so tired we accepted. In hind sight I wish we had walked a few blocks to any of the other hotels in town but we were so tired we weren't thinking straight. I think we would have done better sleeping on the cobblestone sidewalk the bed was so uncomfortable. The sheets felt like rough sandpaper and the bed bowed into the center like a hammock with springs digging into our backs. The pillows were lumpy and smelled of mold. In fact the whole room smelled of mold and stale cigarettes. There was visible mildew on the walls around the windows. There was about a 2 inch difference between the bedroom and the bathroom floors which is very unsafe. I stubbed my toe more than once going in and out of the bathroom. We decided to check out the next day but were told there was a 2 day minimum stay. So we ended up having to pay for a night we never used. Even though we hated to waste the money there was absolutely no way we were going to stay in that room another night. My recommendation is to stay at the Intercontinental or the Shangri-La. For just a few more $ you are going to have an immensely more comfortable experience. I will say without a doubt that the Rendezvous Hotel in Sydney is by far the worse hotel I have ever stayed in. Youâ€™ve been warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families”
Reviews.Author: krispa34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and had booked it at the last minute so got a very good price. We loved it - the location was fantastic - close to public transport (ferries & trains) and nice for a wander around the Rocks and the Harbour. For a family of 5 the room was very spacious and well equipped. We used the kitchen to cook quite a lot which was great for kids. The decor was modern in a brown sort of way. The only negative was that in the bathroom you could hear conversations of people in other rooms through the ventilation duct! Don't miss the excellent Susannah Place Museum just around the corner - a fascinating window into the history of the Rocks (especially when it was a Sydney slum area). The kids really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Could be cleaner; but great to have a kitchen”
Reviews.Author: Anne_from_Ohio
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is difficult to beat--right in The Rocks, a stone's throw from the harbor. And the price was moderate (AU$189 for a twin in April, 2007). While the room and pool could have been cleaner (the blankets definitely needed to be washed, but the sheets were clean), we very much liked having a kitchen. And don't pay rack rate. Check Wotif.com to see what deals are available. This hotel could be very nice with some investment, but then it would probably be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Tastefully Decorated, Nice Hotel--Mysterious Charges on my Credit Card”
Reviews.Author: gakkygreeneyes
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio room (complete with kitchen facilities and a balcony) for 7 nights in February 2008. The room was larger than I expected and tastefully decorated. It was very clean as well. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and my room requests (I requested a balcony) were honored with no hassle.. The location is excellent. I have no complaints about this hotel, except one. Upon arriving home, I noticed an extra $300.00 charge on my credit card. Having kept all of my receipts, I proceeded to go through them as I do not recall having any charges in addition to the fee paid at the end of my stay. Apparently, and for some unknown reason, the hotel made an unauthorized charge AFTER I checked out. I am currently disputing this through proper channels.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: CaroRich
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney on a very early flight and emailed ahead to ask if our room could be ready early. They said they would do their best - and their best was excellent because they allowed us into our room at 8.30 am, very much appreciated after a 23 hour flight. The staff could not have been better, more charming and enthusiastic, the room was spotless and the breakfast buffet is all you need. Superbly located, we would recommend this hotel to everyone unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Love the area, but don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: missbridgett
Reviews.Content: First, I should say that my husband and I liked the location of this hotel. To be fair, the room was nice enough (good size), hotel in general was fine, and location was outstanding. It was fun to stay in The Rocks area and I would suggest that anyone visiting Sydney HAS to stay in this neighborhood. Having said that, we had a HORRIBLE experience with the hotel regarding their breakfast and we do NOT recommend staying here. We are not cheap people or cheap travelers, but when there isn't a price listed for breakfast, we don't expect to be secretly charged for it. In fact, is that even legal?? We've stayed at several hotels where breakfast is included so we had no reason to think otherwise at this hotel. The flier in our hotel room read "Please join us for breakfast"... no price listed or any indication that it wasn't free. Then while we ate from the continental-style spread (bread, cereal and juice counter) we noted there were no signs posted whatsoever that there was a charge, and the woman checking in guests didn't mention it either. ZERO indication about any sort of fee. Thinking the breakfast was complimentary, we had cereal for breakfast each morning. Needless to say we were shocked and angry to find at check out that we were charged for said breakfasts at $15 per person per day! For cereal??!!!! We explained that we were never told of a charge and were clearly very mislead and confused. We requested some sort of compromise given that we felt so misinformed and we were not met with any sort of make-good or even any sympathy. The staff was rude and told us they were not responsible. Nice. We were furious and it took the rest of the day to mentally move on. Even now, 6 months later, I'm still angry enough to post this - I don't appreciate being tricked. And at the very least, they could have offered to refund a day's worth in an effort to compromise. I'm guessing that since we are Americans they assumed we wouldn't be returning anyway... which makes me even angrier. Definately stay in The Rocks area, but do NOT stay in this hotel. If you do insist upon it, don't eat the breakfast!! For that kind of charge you can get a whole lot more than cereal at one of the MANY area restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KazpUk
Reviews.Content: After booking we decided to upgrade to a harbour view which we arranged directly with the hotel. We checked in, opened the balcony door and there was the view - fantastic! Our room was very modern, very clean and so spacious we were able to leave our suitcases opened at the foot of the bed - we were only there for the weekend so didn't feel the need to unpack. The location is perfect for a short stay as its so close to circular quay and the transport links. We did a bondi experience bus trip which showed us some more of the coastline we missed last time which was escellent value for money. We then hopped on the Manly Ferry for great views of the harbour and lunch by the beach. Walked the Rocks area and spent our evenings down on the waterfront. Prior to going we read some poor reviews of this hotel so we were pleasantly surprised at how nice it is. Our room was first class so maybe they have a refurbishment in hand. The staff were very friendly and check out was speedy and the cab ordered for us arrived early for a swift transfer to the airport for the next stage of our journey. That view of the opera house will stay in our minds for a long time and I will always remember sitting on the balcony, cold glass of wine in hand and just drinking it all in. We experienced no noise from the street below and none from within the hotel, all in all a good base.

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust pictures!”
Reviews.Author: AOertzen
Reviews.Content: Lovely area in the rocks, reception deceives you, very friendly staff but then you get to the rooms and it looks like it hasn't been refurbished since 1960! Awful itchy sheets, old kitchenette and old old bathroom. It was clean but really should be 2-3* and no more.

Reviews.Title: “Much Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: markwarl
Reviews.Content: While we didn't pay for the harbour view rooms, my wife and I still really enjoyed our stay at the Rendezvous at the Rocks. Our room was very comfortable, and for only a small hotel it has some great facilities, like the heated pool. It's so central to everthing that we wanted to do in Sydney, especially the bridge climb (do the sunrise session! amazing!). We read trip advisor before going to the hotel, and these issues that some people have had with service seem to have been sorted out, as the service was fantastic. They're very down to earth and friendly. Next time however, I will be paying the extra money for a harbour view and nab one of the balcony rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Crap”
Reviews.Author: rca12340
Reviews.Content: This motel was not as it seemed on their website. As previous reviews have indicated, the girl on reception is a rude and patronising individual. She was trying to teach a younger girl how to use the computer and was showing no joy in doing it and to display this type of displeasure in front of clients is in my opinion not acceptable.I felt really sorry for the younger girl. Also the rooms are nice but for what you pay not really good enough. There are no balconys and there is no rooftop so don't be fooled. You can not see the Opera House or The Rocks from the motel. My fiance took me here for a birthday gift while we were seeing a show at the Opera House and we were both pretty annoyed that it was not what is appears on the website (and having a nasty girl on reception does not help). As also indicated by a previous review, we also had trouble with the parking, we went back and forth from motel to car park to sort out tickets etc. Just really bad management.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: wap13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the Rocks, the old Sydney neighbourhood, vibrant with bars, stores, restaurants and clubs. The hotel in itself has pleasant common areas (restaurant, pool) but very average rooms. The one i stayed in was a small appartment, with a kitchenette, separated bedroom and bath. The carpet were not very fresh and stained throughout. The TV does not provide any pay per view, just regular programming. High speed internet is only by wifi, and you have to pay a supplement. The parking adjacent to the hotel is practical but very expensive (35$ a day).

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: kimmers711
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in one of the "townhomes" on the main level, and we would not stay there again. The two of us sleeping downstairs froze to death because it was wintertime and there were huge cracks under the doors (which lead directly to the street but don't open), and we couldn't get more blankets when we asked. We were also kept up half the night by people talking outside, in addition to smoke wafting under the door into our apartment. It was quite dirty when we arrived, and very basic! I think the regular hotel rooms must have been much nicer...?? The pool was so dirty when we went that I never saw a soul use it. The reception was fairly nice but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Rendezvous Stafford”
Reviews.Author: Butteryville
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Rendezvous Stafford. Front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. Hotel room was nice and big and very clean. The bed was very comfortable and the water pressure in the shower was great! Good location walking distance to lots of restaurants and bars. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Take care when paying your bill”
Reviews.Author: Esporta
Reviews.Content: If you are not an Australian Citizen be extra careful when paying your bill at this hotel. Even though their rooms are not cheap they still screwed me for a little bit of extra profit when I stayed there from 14/2/07 to 19/02/07. When I paid the bill I was very dissatisfied with the evening receptionistâ€™s reply when I told him unequivocally that I wanted to pay the bill in Australian Dollars (AUD). I knew my credit card company always gave the best exchange rate and I asked to pay in AUD, as I had done elsewhere in Sydney. I argued that I did not want a credit card slip showing an exchange rate and a payment in pounds Stirling. He did not seem to know what I was talking about, insisted that this was the way they always did it and the value in pounds was only a guide. I did not see the small print at the bottom of the payment slip stating that I had chosen not to pay in the local currency. On the contrary, I was insisting that I pay in AUD so either he was not fully trained or he purposely misled me. He said he could not accept payment any other way so I could do nothing as I was leaving at 6 a.m. the following morning. Needless to say, their exchange rate resulted in me paying 17 AUD more than what my credit card provider would have charged me. I stayed at 16 Hotels in New Zealand followed by one at Melbourne and Perth. The Rendezvous was the only one that pulled this well-known trick. To add insult to injury, Â£526.65 was deducted from my credit card account on 18/2/07 and for some unknown reason, Â£460.46 was incorrectly credited back the account the following day. I did not know about this because I did not return home to examine the statement for over 6 weeks, due to my holiday in New Zealand and then back to Australia. A later credit card statement showed they debited Â£478.21 from my account, i.e. Â£17.75 more than they incorrectly credited to me. They credited me the money in error and then had the audacity to take an extra Â£17.75 when they debited it back again, i.e. I had to pay for the exchange rate change between the 2 transactions. I emailed the hotel and was pleased when the Hotel Manager, Damien Kelly, apologised for the error and agreed to refund my credit card. After nearly 2 months I have NOT received the refund and I have had no reply to my emails. E-mailing the Mr Alan Featherby, CEO, Rendezvous Hotels was also a waste of time because he has not bothered to reply. I am now waiting to see if Visa will refund the money. PWilliams

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BristolTourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights over Easter 2007 in one of the terraced cottages. The hotel is in a great location in the heart of the Rocks district which in our opinion is the place to stay in Sydney. It is less than a 5min walk to Circular Quay (from/to where regular airport link trains run to the airport in 20mins). Great restaurants are on the doorstep and a couple of lively pubs and bars including the beer keller are round the corner. Its a 30 min walk to to the heart of the shopping district and monorail to Darling Harbour. Bus stops for Bondi express and ferries to Darling Harbour, Manly and Taronga zoo are all a 5 min walkaway. Our cottage was available when we arrived at 8am (although check in is stated as 2pm). After a long flight that was great. There was no sign of a porter and it was a bit of struggle to get cases up and down the steps on the way to the cottages and the reception staff didn't offer to help. Although we managed you might expect some assistance for the price (A$400 a night). The cottages are right on Harrington St and also by the hotel swimming pool so yes expect some noise. Most of the pubs in the area close early anyway so there's little late night noise and we weren't disturbed although traffic woke us in the morning. You have to display a sign on your door to get your room cleaned on a Sunday. Breakfast available but we didn't take it since the area has many lovely restaurants and a number of patiseries and cafes. One thing about the cottages is that although with the sofa bed you can sleep 3 or 4 adults the cottages are all open plan and the bathrooom adjoins the upstairs bed area. The upstairs feels more like a mezzanine.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again if you paid me!!”
Reviews.Author: Perjan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thinking that, for the price, it should be a very nice place to stay. The girl at reception was so rude and unhelpful that we almost left, but had paid in full up front. There was no service at all, staff grumbled rather than give us information, our room was not cleaned on the Sunday and it took us 3 trips to the parking station and back as each person gave us different information regarding payment and cost of parking. We booked and requested a twin share in a townhouse (and called prior to arrival to confirm a TWIN room). We got the townhouse, but upon arrival were told that it was not a twin, but a double and that we would have to pay extra to use the sofa bed. This is at over $300 a night anyway!! The townhouses are right on the street and very near a popular pub, so we basically had no sleep all night. I have stayed in many hotels in many cities around the world, and I have never felt so passionate about writing a review, but this hotel is so very, very bad and the staff are SO VERY RUDE, unhelpful, arrogant and dismissive that I had to warn people to BOOK SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!! THIS PLACE IS THE PITS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tweedybird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days and loved it. It's not a big hotel and it does not have the amenities of a big hotel, but if you are looking for a nice accomodation in a fabulous location, this hotel is great. Our room was ready when we arrived at 11am. We got settled and enjoyed the magnificent view of the Sydney Harbour from our balcony. The room was nicely equipped and was clean. This may not matter to most, the shower was great. After being on a plane for 17 hours, to feel clean mattered to me! The location could not be better. It is 1 block from Circular Quay and in the heart of the Rocks which is a great area in general. We had easy access to all the public transportation which is the best way to get around Sydney. There are restaurants, shops and pubs within a very short walk from the hotel. The staff were very helpful and prompt. We had a smoke detector beeping and our safe would not operate and they were up to repair both within minutes of our call. We had no problems getting a late check-out and they were helpful in telling us how to get places we wanted to go. This hotel would be ideal for anyone staying a week or more as the room has a well-equipped kichenette. We didn't use it much, but had we stayed in Sydney longer, we likely would have.

Reviews.Title: “Why do people love this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: KailuaTara
Reviews.Content: I just don't understand why people love this hotel. My husband and I stayed here for two nights (we were supposed to stay for 5!) in January 2006. When we arrived, our room was supposed to be ready but they made us wait an hour! When we finally got up to the room, they gave us a room that hadn't even been cleaned!! We went back downstairs, they gave us another key and we ended up in a room with cheap, walmart-esque furniture and absolutely no view. We were highly disappointed- we'd booked this hotel based on all these great reviews on tripadvisor.com! After the second night I just couldn't stand it, afterall, this was our honeymoon trip! My husband and I were walking down George St. that night, the main drag in sydney, and stumbled upon the Saville 2 Bond Street hotel. We walked in and asked how much the rooms were and the manager offered to take us up and show us one! She was so nice. When we got up there, it was a studio with a travertine shower, washer and dryer, kitchen with dishwasher, microwave and granite countertops! At the time, the room worked out to be about $200 US a night! We were in heaven! We immediately walked back to the Rendevous, called hotes.como and canceled our resrevation and the next day finally switched hotels. I highly recommend the Saville 2 Bond Street hotel. It's literally a 5 minute walk to Circular Quay and the rocks and a block away from the Wynyard train station. The staff was extremely nice and accomodating and were totally sympathetic with our bad experience at the Rendevous. Don't stay at this hotel, stay at the Saville!!

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: theoldwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of our Aussie Odyssey, and the final night before we flew home. I made the booking by emailing directly to the hotel, and they were fantastic, everything I asked for was delivered, a fourth floor room with a balcony giving views of both the Bridge and Opera House. Unfortunately we never met him, but many thanks to Damien Kelly for making our holiday so special. The location is super, smack in the heart of The Rocks. Close enough to the tourist centre, bars, cafes, shops, and restaurants, but just far enough away from the hurly burly for a quiet nightâ€™s sleep. Circular Quay is five minutes walk away so every possible form of transport, including the airport train, is right there. As well as the balcony, our room had a double bed, plus plenty of space for the sitting area, dining area, and fully equipped kitchenette. The room was clean, well fitted, and the bed comfortable, the bathroom had a bath with shower. We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel, but only because we were out so early and back so late each day. The hotel has two pay-per-use internet machines, and a wireless network that didnâ€™t work at all when we were there. The Rocks tourist centre also has an internet cafÃ©, and offers 30 minutes free wireless access for laptop users. We felt the location and standard of the hotel was excellent value. If you join the Rendezvous Hotelâ€™s eClub programme (free to join), you get a 5% discount on bookings using the groupâ€™s website. You'd be mad to miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: Not sure what hotel some of the reviewers stayed in but after three stays we think this is best value in Sydney. Location could not be better. A bright sparkling clean room with a kitchenette and a small balcony with a view that includes the bridge AND the Opera House! For many multiples more money you could stay at Four Seasons or Westin and have comparable views and an equal location but why spend the money! Our only disappointment was that during our first 2 stays breakfast was included .. now it is a high priced add on. Try the small bakery a short walk down the stairs to the next lower street. don.brown@brownchild.com

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Looeboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights. The studio room was clean and well furnished and the staff helpful at all times. Continental breakfast was perfectly adequate to start the day. The location was perfect, being just a short walk to Circular Quay, the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Darling Harbour was also within walking distance but public transport (bus or ferry) was excellent should you rather not walk. We did the Harbour Bridge Climb which was a fantastic experience. The professionalism and safety aspects were second to none and the climb was not as arduous as I first thought. Also visited Taronga Zoo which afforded a different perspective of the harbour, and took the Bondi Explorer bus for a trip around the city which I recommend. The beach at Bondi is okay but the surrounding shops and accommodation made it look like a shanty town and it was frankly very disappointing. Excellent food at the Opera Bar on the lower concourse of the Opera House but in truth there are so many eateries to choose from. We thoroughly enjoyed our short stay in this fantastic city and recommend the Rendezvous Stafford.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, FANTASTIC View”
Reviews.Author: Warrens_of_Conder
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Rendevous Hotel on the night of the 7th of October 2006 to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary. We purchased a "Romantic" Package which included amongst other things a 'Room with a View' . The Hotel is on the smaller size about 61 rooms and is in a really great position in the Rocks, with its own security parking below the hotel. The room itself was a reasonable size (we were on the 5th floor), clean and tidy, with its own basic kitchenette, microwave and fridge. Our room had a small balcony acessed by sliding doors with a table and chairs. The view is unbeatable for the price with great views from the Opera House all the way around to the Harbour Bridge, we could even see the bridge climbers. The room overall was comfortable and had everything that we needed (comfortable bed and a shower with heaps of pressure). Complimentary Tea and Coffee are included. Bathrooms are basic. Breakfast is next to the pool and is a basic continental but fine. I would recommend booking a room with a view as without the view its just another hotel room. All in all we had a great time and would recommend this hotel to friends, however it is just across the road from the police station and can be noisy especially on saturday nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but quite shabby and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Ynca
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to the Rocks as we were climbing the bridge on our last night in Sydney, but we didn't want to be in the middle of the noise and nightlife, so we chose this one. It was fine, quiet and convenient, but our room was dark and dingey and somehow prison cell like as a result. We had a little kitchenette and a very utilitarian grey bathroom. It really wasn't a room you were going to spend any time in,which suited us fine but at the price, seemed more than a bit of a rip off. The reception staff spoke very poor English and were not especially helpful. We asked to borrow a plug adaptor, and had to pay a 20 dollar deposit! Please! All in all, fine, and suited our purposes, but nothing great and definitely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: kanan
Reviews.Content: Our plane landed early in Sydney and we arrived at the Rendezvous about 8:30 am. Our room wasn't ready but the previous guest had checked out so the front desk asked that our room be cleaned immediately so it would be ready with in the hour. We dropped off our luggage and went down the street for a wonderful breakfast . Came back in an hour and our room was ready!! We had room 511 which had a great view of the harbour and Opera House. It also had a full kitchen, was spacious and very comfortable. The area was perfect! It reminded me of Europe. Small cafes everywhere, and wonderful shops to browse and shop in . We were only a block away from Circular Quay! We were able to walk or catch the ferry to any where we wanted to go. We didn't rent a car as we were a bit intimidated about driving on the "other side" of the road. But it really wasn't needed. We were only in Sydney for 3 days, before we headed up north to Cairns, wish we had more time to spend . There were so many more things we could have done. We enjoyed the Zoo, and the Aquarium , like all good tourists! We also walked to the botanical gardens and while we were at the Aquarium we enjoyed Darling Harbour and the Sydney fish market. It's a pleasant walk from the Aquarium to the fish market. It's great fun to go there for lunch, fresh seafood galore! We'd definitely stay here again the next time we head to Sydney. The area can't be beat and the hotel itself was wonderful!! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Position”
Reviews.Author: MaloneyFamily
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 night stay in Sydney at the Rendezvous. We had put in a request for an early check in as we were to attend a wedding at lunchtime. We didn't hold out much hope but had hoped to be able to dump our luggage and perhaps freshen up. We were very surprised that our room on the 4th floor was ready for us to occupy - some 4 hours early. Good start! Although our balcony was tiny with just enough room to stand, it did offer us glimpses of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour which was a plus. We had a studio apartment with queen size bed which was great and our daughter slept soundly on the sofa bed. The apartment was very spacious with full kitchen facilities. I've seen better bathrooms but it did supply hairdryer. The pool was rather small but there was a spa and sauna too. The staff was fine and the free continental breakfast adequate. If you need a full breakfast, the Lowenbrau Beer Keller is just down the road and serves full breakfast all day. The hotel is positioned so close to everything The Rocks has to offer with Circular Quay just short walk away. Wynyard Station an easy 10 min walk. Other guests attending the wedding also stayed here and we didn't hear any complaints at all, even though the hotel was fully booked for most of our stay. We would definitely stay here again and found the rates to be very reasonable compared to some of the surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: everest
Reviews.Content: It's hard to beat the location of this hotel, but we found our room pretty spare and average. It's a small hotel and they were pretty full the week we were there, so they weren't able to provide us with something more to our liking. We were on the second floor-avoid these rooms as there is no view or balconies in many of them. If I were to stay there again, I would insist on one of the upper floors with a balcony. Otherwise, the staff was OK, but nothing special. The location is hard to beat. Close to everything in the Rocks, with tons of good places to eat and drink. Recommended for coffee in the morning or afternoon snack is the Bakers Oven, which is just down the nurse's walk stairs right across the street from the hotel entrance. Good coffee and food, friendly folks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, awesome views and location”
Reviews.Author: Bendites
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Walking distance to Circualar Quay, Ferries, Trains. Great restaurants and bars in the area. Walk back up the stairs from the hotel to a pizza bar, wine shop and towards the bridge to a great bar that has rooftop seating and quite reasonable beverages and food for the area. We were lucky and got a 5th floor room. You definately want to request 4th or 5th floor with balcony. View is perfect, however cruise ships come in and swallow up your view of the Opera House. Lucky they leave each day. We did not have a balcony room the first night but requested a room change which was accommodated the next night quite nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Book but Beware! ”
Reviews.Author: Frequent travelers
Reviews.Content: Great small apartment hotel in best possible location BUT with serious booking/management problems! Our second stay in 15 mos (minor snafu with first visit - we thought it was an anomaly). This time, despite numbered, written, confirmed reservation, staff failed to honor booking, tried, without comment, to place in vastly inferior room, then stonewalled, then tried to overcharge. ONLY due to our insistence and persistence did we reach an adequate compromise (with a bottle of wine) - still left with lack of confidence in competence and/or credibility! IF you can secure penthouse units (2 rooms/huge balconies/Harbor views @ $450 NZ) OR 4-5 floor studios WITH balcony/views ($286 NZ) it's worth it - this is one of the best in the area - a couple of blocks from the pricey Hyatt. Not sure though that we'd risk it or our vacation again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: AussieAnn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times before and have recommended it many times. It used to be very modern and spotless; not now. The lobby is worn looking and so was the room. The picture on the website makes the balcony look beautiful, but in truth it's very plain and very hot. The breakfast was a typical Comfort Inn type - not what I expect from Australia! I'm afraid the new management/owners have let the place deteriorate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: TandyWhitebits
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading the on-line reviews at Tripadvisor and would defnitely recommend it to anyone else visiting Sydney. If we were being really critical then the hotel room was a little tired looking, but that'a being ultra picky as the room and bathroom were very clean and the view from the balcomy was unbelievable. It's worth paying the extra for an executive studio, or one bedroom room, as they seem to be above the fourth floor and so have bridge and opera house views. At the surrounding hotels a similar view of the harbour would have cost a fortune, so it's very cheap when you take into consideration the amenties (small heated pool and spa)and being so nearby Circular Quay and The Roacks. When we stayed breakfast was included in the price although I think that's changed now. If we go to Sydney again, we would defnitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Wilkies
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Rendezvous Stafford late at night with the plane buzz still in our ears, but just one look out of our room window, our tiredness vanished. There was an uninterrupted view of The Opera House. The location of this hotel is fantastic, just a few minutes walk from Circular Quay. We booked this hotel after reading comments on the website and can wholeheartedly recommend it. We knew it was on The Rocks, but didn't expect such a fantastic location. If we ever visit Sydney again, and I hope we do, it would certainly be our first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jockdoc
Reviews.Content: This was a great location in the Rocks. The apartment itself is beginning to show its age but overall, the staff was friendly and the included breakfast perfect to start off the morning. Having a kitchen and refrigerator makes it fun to shop at markets and making occ lunch and dinner. There is internet access with prepaid card next to the breakfast room. You could get wifi access but you need to install a wireless card in your laptop. Easy walk to the Bridgeclimb, Circular Quay and The Opera House makes it a snap to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov/Dec 2005. This was a fantastic hotel with much more than we needed (I originally booked the hotel for the outdoor pool which due to the bad weather and not having enough time was never used) and the location which was fantastic. Friendly staff they allowed us to have late check out at no extra charge, there is an internet to use which was handy and the breakfast surpassed expectation. This hotel is a little pricey (approx Â£120 per night in Nov/Dec 05) but you are paying for the location and view - from our room we had a superb view of the Opera house and to our left we had a great view of most of the bridge, well worth the extra money. If I was being really critical I would say that I am sure they mentioned a roof terrace when I booked - something I never actually found which is strange for a small hotel and that the windows could do with double glazing to keep the noise out at night but I suppose that is the kind of thing you should expect from a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay, what a find!”
Reviews.Author: Travelsfar1234
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. We stayed on the 6th floor with spectaular views. Ask for room 609 or 610 if you have the extra money to stay in a penthouse room. It is worth the extra money - the view is amazing and you won't find a better hotel with this view for the price. We are very glad we stayed here on our honeymoon. My only complaint is that the hot tub was cold....but the sauna was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location & very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: pmrich74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in Sep05 as part of our honeymoon trip and really enjoyed our stay in Sydney. The hotel is in a great location in the Rocks, with plenty of amenities close by as well as Circular Quay, Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. Very easy to get around and see so many of the sights or just take in the easy going Sydney atmosphere. The room was great with good comfortable bed, lounge area and separate kitchenette. Bathroom was fine (could do with a bit of updating) but the harbour view from our balcony was stunning(see photos), as we were on the 5th floor. The continental breakfast was fine with choice of cereals/toast/yoghurts etc.. if you want a bigger cooked breakfast there's a good cafe on George Street 2 mins walk away. All in all, a very good hotel for a comfortable stay in a great location.

HotelInfo.Name: Rendezvous Stafford Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 75 Harrington Street | The Rocks, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
